author: Staff Reporter
text:
Send memorandum to Prime Minister and Chief Minister

Freedom fighters have urged the Central and State governments to provide two per cent reservation for their family members in education and employment.

In a memorandum sent to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister Jayalalithaa, ‘Thuckalay’ Chandran, founder president of Tamil Nadu Tyagikal Kazhagam (TTK) functioning from Thuckalay, said that the government should take care of the family members of the freedom fighters. Mr. Chandran said that the freedom fighters should be considered for nomination as MPs and MLAs.

Their other demands included special financial assistance for self-employment of their immediate family members, education and special consideration in UPSC appointments, unique identity cards to avail various welfare assistance, and establishment of a separate Ministry for the welfare of the freedom fighters. They also highlighted their long-pending demand for allocation of a land with a building on the outskirts of Chennai for conducting free computer training and tailoring course for the family members of the freedom fighters. Applications submitted by the wards of the freedom fighters for pension were pending with the government for long, Mr. Chandran said.

The government should announce welfare measures for freedom fighters on Martyrs’ Day to be observed on January 30, he added.
title: Freedom fighters demand 2 p.c. quota for family members
